articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A new expedition finds that a large part of the railing at the ship's front has fallen away.
articles.title: Titanic: Striking images reveal depths of ship's slow decay

articles.description: Germany's anti-immigration party Alternative for Germany is on course for victory in the state of Thuringia, an exit poll suggests.
articles.title: German far-right heading for vote win in east - exit poll

articles.description: As Kyiv fights on home soil and in Russia, Nick Beake speaks to recruits being sent to the battlefield.
articles.title: Russia-Ukraine war: Meeting the recruits preparing for battle

articles.description: The beluga whale - nicknamed Hvaldimir - is suspected of having been trained as a spy by Russia.
articles.title: Whale dubbed a Russian spy found dead off Norway

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Paris mayor Anne Hidalgo triggers a debate by saying she wants to keep the Olympic rings on the iconic monument.
articles.title: Row over Paris mayor plan to keep Olympic rings on Eiffel Tower

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: An insider tells the BBC why teenage boys are being targeted with extreme content.
articles.title: Social media: Why algorithms show violence to boys

articles.description: Ashley Paul Griffith confessed to 307 offences at childcare centres in Australia and Italy between 2003 and 2022.
articles.title: Australian childcare worker guilty of abusing dozens of girls

articles.description: Protesting locals say hordes of tourists make the city feel like a "theme park".
articles.title: Málaga tourism: 'People feel the city is collapsing'

articles.description: The high school student jumped from a building in a crowded shopping district, hitting a woman below.
articles.title: Japan teen jumps to death, killing pedestrian below

articles.description: The tiger handler, who was working at Dreamworld when the attack occured, is in a stable condition.
